content.description: Follows the left side of a large roof just East of the main rock.  Start at the base and follow a wandering crack until you reach the roof, then transition left up to the top.
content.location: 20 yards East of the main rock is a formation with an obvious roof with one visible bolt.  It is the crack that follows the left side of the roof.

content.protection: Trad with (3) bolt anchor that can be accessed easily by scrambling around left and reaching the anchor from the North to top rope.
content.location: Most left thin crack on main rock facing highway.  Its finger tight, but there a few edges to use nearby for feet and fingers.

content.description: Nice crack that starts with a layback and transitions to hand jamming.  Yes, it can be covered in bat crap at times.
content.protection: Trad, but can be top roped by slinging one of the large boulders on top.
content.location: Along the right gully of the main rock (East side) just around the corner from Beef Jerky.

content.description: Follow the left corner of the main rock up to the top.
content.location: Left corner of the main face between Cinnamon Bear and Proto Type.

content.description: Granite edge climbing with some cracks depending on the route you take.
content.protection: (4) bolts to anchor.  Can be Top Roped.
content.location: Main face of main rock just above parking area.

content.description: Finger crack located in the right corner of the slab.  Use the crack to make your way up the left facing dihedral.  Caution, the belay point is right on the side of the highway.
content.location: Approximately 150 yards West of the main rock and parking area is a small slab on the North side of the highway.  Just right of Acme Belay Company in the corner.

content.description: Climb is in two sections with a ledge rest in the middle before pulling back onto the rock above.  You can stem the first few moves.
content.protection: Bolts to chains.  You can reach the anchor to top rope by scrambling around left, then bouldering up the East side of the formation.
content.location: Located above the main rock to the left just left of Cinnamon Bear.

content.description: Start your way up a large crack on the left side of the wall.  Pause on the ledge, then transition to the upper rocks left corner before reaching the anchor.
content.protection: Trad for the crack, 3 bolts on the upper section with a two bolt anchor up top.  You can reach the anchor to top rope this by scrambling around left, then bouldering on up onto the rock on the East side.
content.location: Up hill and left of the main crag located on the left corner of the Far Side.  Look for the bolts on the West corner of the upper rock.

content.description: Start on You Bet Your Life until you reach the roof.  Stretch out to reach the (1) bolt that protects the roof then transition up and over the roof.
content.protection: Trad plus (1) bolt on the roof.
content.location: About 20 yards East of the main rock is a formation with a large roof.  Starts on You Bet Your Life then transitions to the roof.

content.description: Fun short granite flake with small holds and a few spots to under cling.
content.protection: Top rope anchor with chains.  Scramble around left and access the anchor from the North side of the formation.
content.location: Just to the right of Far Side on the west side of the main rock.  Scramble up the backside to reach top rope anchor.

content.description: Route begins on the right side of the main rock and follows a ramp to the left.  Shares Anchor with Le Cirque.
content.location: Far right side of main face of main rock.

content.description: Small finger crack on the left side of the face.  Caution, the belay point is right next to the road.
content.protection: Trad, small stoppers or TCUs.  Walk off right.
content.location: Approximately 150 yards West of the main rock and parking area is a smooth slab with two finger cracks located right on the North side of the highway.
